commands.name: help
commands.description: Displays help for a command
commands.help:
The <info>help</info> command displays help for a given command:

  <info>php bin/terminus help list</info>

You can also output the help in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>php bin/terminus help --format=xml list</info>

To display the list of available commands, please use the <info>list</info> command.

format.name: --format
format.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: list
commands.description: Lists commands
commands.help:
The <info>list</info> command lists all commands:

  <info>php bin/terminus list</info>

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

  <info>php bin/terminus list test</info>

You can also output the information in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>php bin/terminus list --format=xml</info>

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

  <info>php bin/terminus list --raw</info>

format.name: --format
format.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

commands.help:
Show operation data for a workflow
Note: Operation descriptions only exist for Quicksilver operations and the column will be otherwise blank.

site_id.name: site_id
site_id.description: Name or ID of the site that the workflow is part of

id.name: --id
id.description: UUID of the workflow to show

format.name: --format
format.description: Format the result data. Available formats: csv,json,list,php,print-r,sections,string,table,tsv,var_export,xml,yaml

fields.name: --fields
fields.description: Available fields: Type (type), Result (result), Duration (duration), Operation Description (description)

field.name: --field
field.description: Select just one field, and force format to 'string'.

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.name: workflow:info:status
commands.description: Show status information about a workflow
commands.help: Show status information about a workflow

site_id.name: site_id
site_id.description: Name or ID of the site that the workflow is part of

id.name: --id
id.description: UUID of the workflow to show

format.name: --format
format.description: Format the result data. Available formats: csv,json,list,php,print-r,string,table,tsv,var_export,xml,yaml

fields.name: --fields
fields.description: Available fields: Workflow ID (id), Environment (env), Workflow (workflow), User (user), Status (status), Started At (started_at), Finished At (finished_at), Time Elapsed (time)

field.name: --field
field.description: Select just one field, and force format to 'string'.

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question

commands.description: List the workflows for a site
commands.help: List the workflows for a site

format.name: --format

fields.name: --fields

field.name: --field
field.description: Select just one field, and force format to 'string'.

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction

commands.name: workflow:watch
commands.description: Stream new and finished workflows of the given site to the console
commands.help: Stream new and finished workflows of the given site to the console

verbose.name: --verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

no-interaction.name: --no-interaction
no-interaction.description: Do not ask any interactive question
